data.description:
Our innovative platform offers a comprehensive and fully interactive IELTS preparation and English language learning experience using Virtual Reality (VR) and the Metaverse. Whether you are aiming for academic or general IELTS exams or simply want to improve your English skills, our platform has you covered.

Key Features:

Interactive VR IELTS Courses:

Exam Overview: Understand the IELTS exam format and requirements.
VR IELTS Reading: Practice reading comprehension in immersive VR environments.
VR IELTS Listening: Enhance your listening skills with VR audio simulations.
VR IELTS Speaking: Engage in realistic speaking exercises in VR.
VR IELTS Academic Writing: Improve your academic writing skills through VR activities.
VR IELTS General Writing: Hone your general writing skills in a virtual setting.
Language Proficiency Assessment:

Take a language proficiency assessment test to determine your current English level.
Timed Sectional Tests:

Access timed tests for each IELTS section (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking) with comprehensive evaluations provided instantly.
AI-Powered Conversations:

Engage in conversations with artificial intelligence to practice speaking and receive real-time feedback and evaluation.
Lesson-Based Questions:

Test your comprehension and retention with lesson-based questions.
Diverse Virtual Environments:

Immerse yourself in various VR environments that simulate real-life scenarios to enhance your language skills.
Our VR application allows you

email : m.galal@transformologyxr.com
password : galal1234

username : aliha100 and password : a12345678 for test app
no registration in this app because my app is Linked to a control panel Enter courses and questions and register students

----------------------------------------------------
We are developing an application that helps students prepare for the IELTS exam. Consequently, we need to include the SPEAKING exam, which involves recording audio for evaluation purposes. I need to write a note explaining why I am requesting these permissions. Here's the note in English:
android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO: This permission is essential to enable recording audio during practice sessions. Students can simulate the speaking section of the IELTS exam, allowing them to assess their performance and identify areas for improvement.

android.permission.MODIFY_AUDIO_SETTINGS: This permission enables us to adjust audio settings within the application, ensuring optimal recording quality and a seamless user experience.

android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE and android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE: These permissions are necessary for storing and retrieving recorded audio files. This functionality allows students to review their practice sessions and track their progress over time.

android.permission.READ_MEDIA_AUDIO, android.permission.READ_MEDIA_VIDEO, android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES, android.permission.ACCESS_MEDIA_LOCATION, and android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGE: These permissions are used to access media files, such as audio recordings, videos, and images, stored on the device. This enables students to manage their practice materials efficiently within the app

Regarding the application, it is an educational app for teaching English language for free, and its purpose is not profit-oriented. If the goal were profit, we would have added in-app purchases.

As for the recent comments, a function has been added to reset the player when they reach a certain distance. We have also adjusted the game's quality and optimized its performance.
